data.title: Catholic Church in Portugal
data.text:
Religions: Roman Catholic 81%, other Christian 3.3%, other (includes Jewish, Muslim, other) 0.6%, none 6.8%, unspecified 8.3%

Languages: Portuguese (official), Mirandese (official, but locally used)

Ethnic Groups: homogeneous Mediterranean population; citizens of black African descent who immigrated to mainland during decolonization number less than 100,000; since 1990, East Europeans have migrated to Portugal

Motto: O bem da Nação (Portuguese) (The good of the nation)

Area: 91,982 km²

Catholic Population: 9,050,000 Catholics (87.9% of 10,298,000 total)

Pastoral Centres: 4,574 parishes, 4 mission stations (3 with resident priest, 1 without resident priest), 1,831 other centres

Clergy: 46 bishops (20 diocesan, 26 titular), 3,267 priests (2,389 diocesan, 878 religious), 420 permanent deacons (416 diocesan, 4 religious)

Non-Clergy: 4,076 religious (215 brothers, 3,861 sisters), 479 members of secular institutes (sisters), 468 major seminarians, 147 missionaries, 49,468 catechists
